intro: Genosiris fragilis, commonly known as the brittle genosiris, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, wiry stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has palmate leaves with a waxy surface that helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Genosiris fragilis is considered a vulnerable species.
